page.title: 04The Canal
page.content: After the boom years came the decline with the coming of the railways and then with the perfection of better road building. However, barges contined to take timber to Chelmsford until quite recently. Springfield Duke was the name of the last horse to pull a barge to Chelmsford in the Sixties and the last load was taken by diesel barge in 1972. Presently the canal is used mainly for leisure and pleasure. A barge trip can be bought from the lock in Little Baddow and the water is still used for rowing, canoeing and pleasure boating. The canal is also used by fishermen and many people enjoy walking beside the canal. It is an asset of the area and it needs to be carefully cultivated so that future generations can enjoy it.
